contextId.occurrenceNote: This double negative means that all things will be subject to Christ. Alternate translation: "God made everything subject to them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-doublenegatives]])
contextId.quote: οὐδὲν οὐδὲν ἀφῆκεν ἀφῆκεν αὐτῷ ἀνυπότακτον
contextId.glQuote: He did not leave anything not subjected to him

contextId.occurrenceNote: This double negative means that he will claim them as his brothers. Alternate translation: "is pleased to call them his brothers" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-doublenegatives]])
contextId.glQuote: is not ashamed to call them brothers

contextId.occurrenceNote: "But that message did not benefit those who did not join with the people who believed and obeyed." The author is talking about two groups of people, those who received God's covenant with faith, and those who heard it but did not believe. This can be stated in positive form. Alternate translation: "But that message benefited only those who believed and obeyed it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-doublenegatives]])
contextId.glQuote: But that message did not benefit those who did not unite in faith with those who obeyed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This double negative means that, in fact, Jesus does feel sympathy with people. Alternate translation: "we have a high priest who can feel sympathy ... Indeed, we have" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-doublenegatives]])
contextId.glQuote: we do not have a high priest who cannot feel sympathy ... Instead, we have

contextId.occurrenceNote: This double negative can mean that God in his justice will remember what good things his people have done. Alternate translation: "For God is just and therefore will certainly remember" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-doublenegatives]])
contextId.quote: οὐ γὰρ ἄδικος ἄδικος ὁ Θεὸς ἐπιλαθέσθαι
contextId.glQuote: For God is not so unjust that he would forget

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in positive form. Alternate translation: "he always brought blood" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-doublenegatives]])
This can be stated in positive form. Alternate translation: "a person can please God only if he has faith in God" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-doublenegatives]])
contextId.glQuote: without faith it is impossible to please him

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be expressed as a positive encouragement. Alternate translation: "also work hard to be holy, because only holy people will see the Lord" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-doublenegatives]])
contextId.quote: καὶ τὸν ἁγιασμόν οὗ χωρὶς οὐδεὶς ὄψεται τὸν Κύριον
contextId.glQuote: also the holiness without which no one will see the Lord

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in positive form. Alternate translation: "you pay attention to the one who is speaking" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-doublenegatives]])
contextId.glQuote: you do not refuse the one who is speaking
